description: Great DAW for sound design and electronic music.

I'm not sure what this app is looking for but I guess my lowly old system just doesn't have it. When I try to run it, I hear my drive making noise and then it stops after 10 seconds. 

I'm using Linux Lite 5.8 with only 2GB of RAM. I will try to remove it and re-install it but if that doesn't work, I guess I'm just out of luck.

I love the comunism, but the idiocracy not. 
Get out the payment spy-soft from here... suport only GPL and free coders comunity !
I've been using it since version 1 and I've produced many songs that I'm proud of with it.

I just love Bitwig Studio. You can do all kinds of things, with a very familiar workflow if you've used Ableton Live. 

The sound quality is awesome. The resource usage really good and the sound libraries are just great.

An end to end production software. I just love it.
summary: The best DAW I've ever used

description: I'm happy that I can use it on Fedora and stop using it on Mac!
Glad that I don't need ti care for update manually anymore.
summary: One of the most advanced DAW

description: Finally something Pro for audio production.
Really polished digital audio workstation with similar workflows to Ableton Live, but perfectly supported on Linux/Pipewire.
Bitwig is actually better as Ableton ^^ You can add Plugins (VST) via org.freedesktop.LinuxAudio.Plugins this makes Linux a good platform for music producers :D
summary: Bitwig is the best Ableton alternative what you can find on Linux !

description: The only propper audio production tool on linux

This looks like a nice program however note IT'S NOT FREE. you need to buy this so it should not be on the Linux repos but on standard internet. Linux should be as always free, paid should be for the internet download.
An amazing playground for sound construction and making songs.
summary: so great this also runs on Linux!

description: Being a Bitwig Certified Trainer, I feel the need to be able to support users on any OS. But as a hardcore Linux enthusiast, why switch to flatpak?
Used this without any real hiccup since V1 - will continue to renew my subscription as they continue to develop and support software of this calibre on Linux
summary: Awesome product, well deserving of support

description: Uninstalled forever..
This is by far one of the best DAWs out there. And I've tried em all.

I literally bought this just because I switched to Linux and needed something like Ableton Live. 

It was that, but it was more. The GUI is much ore intuitive that the one in Live, it took me less time to learn and a shorter time get a fast workflow.

Also, I thought I was goint to miss Max, but - Bitwig's approach is better. Every plugin can be modulated with the same impressive tools, making it modular. If you are curious, test this out for yourself. 

In the last updates, much needed things like comping and a convolution reverb, pipewire support ++ showed up. The result of this is that I went from using two DAWs on a mac (Logic and Live) to one on Linux. I don't even miss all those third party plugins I loose on linux (which I could use with yabrigde anyway... But so far, I don't). 

All in all. Bitwig is my favorite DAW. And the programmers add so much new stuff all the time that I am in awe. No other DAW is developed so fast. 

As for stability, I have only had issues when I used beta versions, but that's really what to expect. The stable versions are indeed stable.
Vielseitig, da flexibel. In ständiger Entwicklung (hoffentlich noch recht lange...), läuft einwandfrei unter Linux (auch unter debian z.B.), aus meiner Sicht unbedingt empfehlenswert.

Ich nutze Bitwig seid der Version 1.0 und muss sagen es hat sich gemacht.
Für alle die Ableton für Linux suchen oder kreativ Sounddesign betreiben wollen bietet Bitwig eine super Fülle an Möglichkeiten. 

Wer jedoch eher klassiche Audio schneiden will, im besonderen Mehrspur Schlagzeug aufnahmen oder ähnliches, wird noch ein bisschen kreativ sein müssen, denn Tools wie Beat Detective gibt es derzeit noch nicht. Aktionen wie "Slip editing" sind möglich, erfordern jedoch ein wenig nachdenken, denn selbsterklärend ist es hier dann doch nicht. 

Wer sich unsicher ist ob Bitwig was ist, einfach die Demo testen.

:D
summary: Für mich die DAW unter Linux

description: excellente application
не запускается и не удаляется
Крута классно мне понравилось
Не могу удалить!
Крутой и профессиональный инструмент. И круто, что теперь он выпускается и как флатпак.
The best audio production app
